conclusion: To compare average velocities, analyze the area under velocity-time graphs.
Area under velocity-time graph represents displacement.
For Car A, area under curve from t=0 to t=t1 is bounded by curve and time axis.
For Car B, area under curve from t=0 to t=t1 is bounded by curve and time axis.
Area under curve for Car A is greater than for Car B.
Average velocity of Car A is total displacement divided by total time t1.
Average velocity of Car B is total displacement divided by total time t1.
Since displacement of Car A is greater, average velocity of Car A is greater than Car B.
